review_title: NHCC has a family work environment with excellent opportunities
job_title: Senior Director in Valley Stream, NY
pros: Working at NHCC provides you with the opportunity to help other, learn, collaborate, advance your career as we are always looking to promote from within. Leadership is always looking to improve and to provide the best possible care to the population we serve.
cons: Healthcare $ $ $ $

job_title: Care Coordinator in Hempstead, NY
pros: Good working relationships Everyone works together well and helps each other
cons: Large case load Having to rush through clients

job_title: Therapist in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: Good working environment, colleagues are nice
cons: Low pay, need better benefits

job_title: Fee for Service Therapist in New York, NY
pros: They take all types of clients and have a variety of therapists
cons: They don’t provide work shops for employees to learn more skills. Therapist also take on an enormous amount of clients for not enough pay. But that’s the industry.

job_title: Care Coordinator in Queens, NY
pros: only good thing is that you work from home but, you still have to meet with your clients every couple of months to update paper work.
cons: the pay does not equal up to the workload

review_title: Great Place to Work, fulfilling job role
job_title: Director in Nassau, NY
pros: I am able to make a difference in the lives of my clients and feel supported by my direct supervisors. The agency really helped a lot of people during the pandemic, when many other agencies closed or could not give appropriate care. They compensate financially for hard work.
cons: Our time off could be improved- sick time, personal time and holidays- to compete better with other agencies.

review_title: Great Supervisors, Great Teamwork, Happy to be there
job_title: HARP Care Coordinator in Copiague, NY
pros: I really enjoy working at New horizon Counseling Center, it will be 3 years in August. I really enjoy my job because of the constant feedback we get, our coworkers work very hard, and I feel we gain so much knowledge from supervision, and the other coworkers who will go out of their way to help you and work with you until you’re extremely proficient in the task.
cons: The health insurance can be expensive.

job_title: Office Manager in Ozone Park, NY
pros: Experience in various aspects of running an office. You need to be a Jack of all trades as you do everything.
cons: Minimum wage, upper management favor certain races and religions, no PTO unless you get it approved first that includes sick time.

job_title: Therapist in Copiague, NY
pros: Fee for service pay is good
cons: frequent changes, sometimes hostile environment

job_title: Unit Supervisor in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: I've worked with NHCC for more than 5 years and am truly satisfied overall. NHCC has open-door management and recognizes its care management team consistently and effectively. The care coordination role is for a pro-active person who cares about people's individual needs, maintains accountable records, understands community issues, and wants to make a positive different in underserved communities. You'll have a team of supportive care coordinators and inclusive supervisors and trainers who reflect individual and group motivation, and fosters your strengths and promotes your growth.
cons: Intermittent weather and peak traffic.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Copiague Harbor, NY
pros: Helping the people, alot of luncheon given
cons: Stop making employees make referrals to clients for additional services. Stop cross selling. Very heavy work load for therapist

job_title: Employment Specialist in Valley Stream, NY
pros: dedicated to their staff and clients, encourage new procedures and techniques as well as giving any support that’s needed from upper staff
cons: it’s a little far from my house, they could be a little more strict with clients retention and there is a limit to paid holidays.

job_title: Social Worker/Psychotherapist in Ozone Park, NY
pros: -Great clinic director, friendly work environment, very collaborative -Awesome environment for budding clinicians, you will get to see a bit of everything and gain a ton of experience
cons: -Health insurance plans are very expensive -401k's are not offered for the first year of employment

job_title: Medical Receptionist in Smithtown, NY
pros: NHCC cares so much for their clients and make sure to ensure a great experience with so much help offered.
cons: Seeing people struggle can be hard but you have to remember that you are a part of helping them!

job_title: Therapist in Smithtown, NY
pros: New Horizon offers a ton of opportunities for experience. Supervisory staff works to be as available as possible to assist. Positive working environment with a lot of room for growth.
cons: The workload can be demanding, short lunch breaks.

review_title: NHCC is a great place to gain experience as a Care Coordinator with supportive staff and opportunity for growth.
job_title: Care Coordinator in Hempstead, NY
pros: The adult Care coordination team is lead effectively by a Program Manager who is very approachable, encouraging, and supportive in her role. The children's Care coordination team is currently small and looking to grow due to the need in the communities served. It is led by a Program Supervisor who is enthusiastic, has great team ethics, makes everyone feel welcome, and doesn't hesitate to offer support while multitasking multiple things. All members of the Childrens team support each other professionally but feel like extended family. Overall NHCC has a good work culture with chance for growth. PROS: Good work culture/ Opportunity for growth/ Yearly evaluations can lead to a percentage increase/ 401K
cons: CONS: Health insurance rates are high/ Many social work based positions do not pay great.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Valley Stream, NY
pros: Excellent work/life balance, everyone I work with is kind and respectful, you don't feel like just another a pulse here.
cons: I honestly don't have any cons.

job_title: Full-time Employee in Valley Stream, NY
pros: Great PTO - Family Oriented - Open Doors - Flexible
cons: Only downside I can think of is to upgrade the health insurance.

job_title: Receptionist in New York, NY
pros: Great place to work. Great team !
cons: more and more job duties

review_title: I have no need to work anywhere else.
job_title: HARP Care Coordinator in Jamaica, NY
pros: Real Time support/assistance from management and coworkers.
cons: My healt insurance should cost less.

job_title: Care Coordinator in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: The only pro is working from home, and PTO
cons:
This is one of the worst companies I've worked for. The supervisors/program managers are ghetto, and do not know how to talk to anyone- unless the higher ups are in the meetings. The program managers, and supervisors talk about the CCs behind their backs, and play favourites. When you are trying to voice your opinion on something they will shut you out unless they like you. Everyone is against you, and will try to isolate you from the team. Some of the clients are rude and cuss you out. And the program managers/supervisors talk about the higher-ups behind their back. If they can do that to them imagine what they can do to you.

The company make empty promises to the clients on housing and when we explain that we don't have housing we get harassed and cussed out. As a CC we are supposed to take care of the mental/medical well being but they have you doing work for housing like you're a real estate agent. They have you doing 10 different jobs and UNDERPAY you. It is not worth the pain and suffering. They also don't pay you enough to have to go the neighbourhoods and travel about to meet these clients. 

RUN FROM THIS COMPANY AND DON'T TURN BACK!

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Far Rockaway, NY
pros:
Coworkers are great support team
Productive when working remote
cons:
Low pay 
No benefits 
You have to beg for a salary review 
You work 3-4 roles for 1 salary 
PTO sucks

The only good thing about this place are your coworkers who suffers with you when it comes to the lack of quality in management. No one has any clue what the senior director of care management actually does. He has no idea how to assist staff but will have other hard workin employees redirected to make him look good. On top of that he has no backbone. Clinacle director is far much better at managing the program. This place will have one staff filling 3-4 roles to save them money while they pocket the money themselves. The turnover rate is high. No benefits at all. Pto days are too low but yet they have the audacity to be stingy with the little time off they give.
Micromanagement at best. 
Just turn away from this place. Run. Not worth it. No respect here. They promote those who are in their circle.
Low pay, micromanagement, no salary increase. You practically have to reach out for an increase or review. It’s like you are asking for an arm, leg and kidneys. Only 6 holidays off. Director like to pull a report on everything which is so annoying. Like what do you really do dude???

job_title: Therapist in Far Rockaway, NY
pros: salary was high for entry level therapist
cons: micro management, 60 client case loads,

review_title: Glad to be a part of an Amazing Team!
job_title: Client Engagement Specialist in Far Rockaway, NY

No cons. "Train your mind to see the good in everything"

review_title: A great company to work for.

I love working for New Horizon Counseling Center.
